alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 1:48PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding along and downstream of the McBride burn scar caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. The local emergency manager reported minor debris flow occurring, including within Gavilon Canyon. Between 0.15 and 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
